subtitle.Text: Steve: So earlier in... in an earlier version of the story in Gone Home,
Sam and Lonnie got caught together and Lonnie's dad was an asshole about it,
and threatened to send Lonnie to live with her mom in Florida.
And we cut that, it was too melodramatic and it wasn't really interesting,
and it was an external force that was acting on them which I wasn't super excited about in practice and so on and so forth, but...
it caused there to be this concept of Lonnie's mom living in Florida, which...
Karla: Florida is of course the worst place you can live.
Steve: Well... Let's not... assume... but, that said, it's the other side of the country, and it's totally so foreign from Oregon and everything... Also it's where I grew up.
Karla: Yeah, that was why I was kidding you.

Steve: So, yes, the reason I think that Lonnie's mom lives in Florida is that I grew up in Florida, and I moved from Florida to Oregon when I was like 19, and... I've been back to visit, but you know.
Karla: They... Steve: If someone were to say to me, "Hey Steve, do you want to go back and live in Florida?",
I would take a sheet of notebook paper, and I would write NO on it as big as you can get... Karla: With gravestones.
Steve: ...and hand it back to you. There would be knives, there would be gravestones, there would be lightning... Karla: Dead face.
Steve: ... big Xs in the eyes, vampire teeth for some reason...
Karla: I was largely unfamiliar with Florida, and my family started going there every once in a while when I was in high school for Christmas, because my mom hates being cold...
Steve: Picked the wrong goddamn place to live, Mrs. Zimonja.
Karla: I know, yeah, well, you know... But anyway, the only thing that I remember, basically, is that everybody had lawn flamingos,
and we went around Christmas, so I remember hearing on the radio multiple times, dogs barking Christmas carols. That's Florida.
Steve: Florida sounds cooler than I remember it being!
Karla: In my head, that's Florida. Right there.
